trans-unit.source: APCu Object Cache provides a persistent backend for the WordPress object cache using APC / APCu, a PHP key/value store saved in memory.
https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2818#section-3.1: RFC2818, Section 3.1
https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3490: IDNA specification
https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3492: Punycode/Bootstrap specification
Memcached Object Cache provides a persistent backend for the WordPress object cache. A memcached server and the PECL memcached extension are required.

W3 Total Cache provides object level caching using disk, opcode or memcache(d) memory stores. W3TC also provides: browser, page and database caching, in addition to Content Delivery Network Support, Mobile Support, Minification and more.

LiteSpeed Cache supports the use of Redis, Memcached, and LSMCD object caches. LSCWP also provides server-level full-page caching, support for browser cache and CDN, and other optimization features. LiteSpeed Web Server required.

Redis Object Cache supports the use of Predis (PHP client library), HHVM’s Redis extension and the PECL Redis extension to provide a persistent backend for the WordPress object cache. Redis is required.

query_posts() is a way to alter the main query that WordPress uses to display posts. It does this by putting the main query to one side, and replacing it with a new query. To clean up after a call to query_posts, make a call to wp_reset_query(), and the original main query will be restored.
trans-unit.target: query_posts () es una forma de alterar la consulta principal que usa WordPress para mostrar publicaciones. Para ello, deja la consulta principal a un lado y la reemplaza con una nueva consulta. Para limpiar después de una llamada a query_posts, haga una llamada a wp_reset_query () y se restaurará la consulta principal original.

trans-unit.source: query_posts() is meant for altering the main loop. It does so by replacing the query used to generate the main loop content. Once you use query_posts(), your post-related global variables and template tags will be altered. Conditional tags that are called after you call query_posts() will also be altered – this may or may not be the intended result.
trans-unit.target: query_posts () está destinado a alterar el bucle principal. Lo hace reemplazando la consulta utilizada para generar el contenido del bucle principal. Una vez que use query_posts () , las variables globales relacionadas con la publicación y las etiquetas de plantilla se modificarán. Las etiquetas condicionales que se invocan después de llamar a query_posts () también se modificarán; este puede ser o no el resultado deseado.

trans-unit.source: query_posts() is only one way amongst many to query the database and generate a list of posts. Before deciding to use query_posts(), be sure to understand the drawbacks.
trans-unit.target: query_posts () es solo una forma entre muchas de consultar la base de datos y generar una lista de publicaciones. Antes de decidir usar query_posts () , asegúrese de comprender los inconvenientes.
